file_content.text: Thanks again for your help. I really owe you, big time.
You're back! Thank goodness. Did you get all the devices in place?
The devices are all in place.
Yes, it's done.
I managed.
What a relief. I really can't thank you enough for your help.
The mission that was too hard for you is all taken care of.
Don't worry, your job's safe.
I'm just glad it's done. What a relief.
All right, let's see if these things work. They're booting up now... synchronizing and....
It's working! The frequencies are all clearing, one by one! This is fantastic!
Glad to have helped.
I never could have done this without you! Never! Amazing!
Will you be able to conduct your surveillance?
Can you do your work now?
What? Oh, yes, definitely. The air couldn't be clearer.
Let's settle up.
Oh, uh, right. Sorry.
Here. I could never reward you enough for what you've done.
I'll notify headquarters that the jammers are down. Thanks again for your help--this mission would have been a complete failure without you.
Come back once you've planted the devices, and I'll activate them from here.
Hey, you--hold up.
No, no, don't look at me, just look casual. Act like you're not talking to anyone.
My name's Jaffkee. I'm with Republic security. Is the street clear? Any Justicar patrols?
I don't see any Justicars in the street.
No, we're safe.
All right, good. It should be safe for us to talk--for now.
Are you always this jumpy?
Take it easy.
I am when I'm in a place like this!
You're crazy.
What? I'm--no, no, that's not it at all. I'm just trying to warn you, is all.
I already tangled with the Justicars. Trust me, you don't want to underestimate these guys.
I'll stay alert.
Gladly. I wouldn't want anyone else making the same mistake I did.
Any reason you've stayed?
I'm supposed to disrupt the Justicars' signal jammers, so Republic security can run some useful surveillance on these guys.
If you survived, the Justicars can't be that tough.
I'm not too worried.
I'm only alive because I ran. Hard.
Republic security was actually excited about the Justicars at first. A bunch of ex-military guys forming a militia to take back the streets!
The Justicars weren't the allies you'd hoped for.
But that wasn't the case.
I didn't realize Republic security needed help so badly.
These must be desperate times.
Well, with so much money going into the military, we don't get much in terms of funds or manpower.
Not everyone who shares your goals is an ally.
A common purpose isn't enough.
A militia full of military veterans is the kind of thing I try to avoid.
Sounds like trouble to me.
You can never rely on militias, agent--even ex-military.
No surprise that didn't work.
Republic security hoped the Justicars would work alongside our officers--bring order to Coruscant's lower levels.
But they pushed out Republic forces just like they did the criminals. They keep the peace down here, but they definitely aren't on the Republic's side.
If the Justicars aren't working with the Republic, then who are they working with?
Then whose side are they on?
No clue. They pushed out Black Sun and the other criminal groups, but their goals are still a mystery.
You were sent to find out more about the Justicars, right?
So you're here to investigate.
Uh, not exactly.
As long as they stay out of my way, I couldn't care less.
Doesn't matter to me.
The Justicars generally kill or imprison trespassers caught in their territory.
I'm not interested in a history lesson.
Spare me the details.
The Justicars aren't the allies we'd hoped for. In fact, they shoot Republic forces on sight.
We've tried to run surveillance on their activities, but their signal jammers block every attempt.
I thought disrupting the jammers would be easy, but the Justicar patrols are everywhere.
It would be a privilege to assist an agent of the Republic.
I'd be honored to lend a hand.
Really? That... that would be great!
You seem very certain that this can't be done.
No chance at all?
No, I'm sure somebody could do it... I just don't think I could.
For the right price, I could make this problem go away.
It's time you hired a pro.
Really? I'm sure I could make it worth your time!
Objectives don't complete themselves, agent.
Buck up, kid.
Maybe I could deal with this.
I... yes! Yes, that'd be great!
Too bad.
I just... I really hate to let everyone down like this. They were counting on me.
You definitely look like you can handle the job... better than I could, anyway.
I built the devices to disrupt the Justicars' jammers. They just need to be installed--can you do that for me?
I'll take the devices and place them for you.
Consider it done.
Thank you so much! Here, take the devices.
They need to be planted at several points around the district. That's the tricky part--Justicar patrols are everywhere.
Once you've planted the devices, make your way back. Good luck, and... thanks.
You're on your own.
I can't help. [Refuse quest]
Oh. Uh, okay, well, thanks for your time, then.
Maybe I can get my stealth belt working again, make another go at it.
Um... excuse me. Excuse me! Master Jedi?
Ahem. Ahem! You, you there. The soldier. Could I... could you spare a minute?
The Justicar patrols are everywhere!
Yeah, yeah, okay.
